summary: This is an FBI news briefing from November 12, 2020, covering various national security, criminal investigation, and political topics. It includes a brief mention that plaintiffs in the Epstein case missed deadlines for keeping testimony secret, but the document is primarily focused on other FBI activities and national news.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in context of a civil lawsuit where plaintiffs missed deadlines to keep testimony secret.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the defendant in a civil lawsuit with Epstein accuser Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
persons.context: Mentioned as the plaintiff in a settled civil dispute against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Loretta Preska
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge overseeing the case between Ghislaine Maxwell and Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's accused co-conspirator in the document.
Maxwell and Giuffre were parties in a now-settled civil lawsuit.

events.title: Deadline for opposing document release passes
events.description: A deadline passed without opposition from two non-parties regarding the release of their depositions in the Maxwell-Giuffre case.

keyFacts: Plaintiffs in the Jeffrey Epstein case missed deadlines for keeping testimony secret.
The civil dispute between Ghislaine Maxwell and Virginia Roberts Giuffre has been settled.
Two non-parties in the Maxwell-Giuffre case did not oppose the proposed redaction and release of documents identifying them.
The release of more documents from the case appears to be imminent as no opposition was filed.
The document is primarily an FBI news briefing covering a wide range of topics, with the Epstein case mentioned only briefly in one section.
